acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.91mg/L of the fish (Carp) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 0.104mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,761mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in rat and mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)). Also due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category 3 by IARC (1987).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and rapidly degrading and bio-accumulation were unknown, it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro chromosome aberration tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)), in vivo micronucleus tests on rat bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)), though in vitro reverse mutation tests showed positive (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988, 1993)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of severe irritation which persisted for at least 7 days of observation in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation with a Draize score of ca.1.3, which was fully reversed within 7 days, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 5.05mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data))

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There were effects on the blood system, but the exposure doses exceeded the guidance value ranges for Category 2 by a factor of 1.5.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 2 (central nervous system),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In single dose oral toxicity studies in mice, clinical signs including soft feces, reduced locomotor activity and crouching were noted at dose levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2, whereas in single dose inhalation toxicity studies in rats, clinical signs including abnormal respiratory sounds, lacrimation and inanimation were seen at dose levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
